bioghist.p: Louis Minsky founded Religious News Service in 1934 under the auspices of the National Conference of Christians and Jews. From the start, Religious News Service (RNS) was dedicated to providing authoritative and bias-free news about religion and ethics to both the secular and religious press. In 1983, Religious News Service was acquired by the Dallas-based United Methodist Reporter and continued to operate as an independent news agency. In 1991, Religious News Service editorial copy was distributed to the secular press by New York Times Syndicated Features, Inc. In 1994, Religious News Service was purchased by Newhouse News Service (NNS), and its name was changed to Religion News Service. NNS is a company of Advance Publishing, a major publisher of daily newspapers, as well the Conde Nast family of magazines, and Parade. Universal Press Syndicate now distributes the service to daily and weekly newspapers in the U.S.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Religious News Service. Materials include: chronological semiweekly news releases, 1940-1979; Religious News Reporters, which are weekly radio scripts of religious news, 1939-1981; Week in Religion; special features, including Year in Religion, Religious Remarkables, News Flashes, Inspirational Editorials, Editorial Cartoons, articles by Reinhold Niebuhr (1940s), Washington Review, and Churchmen in the News; a binder entitled "Presentation of RNS Output" with samples of various news releases; RNS news releases, newspaper and magazine clippings; brochures; reports from other organizations; and draft copies from reporters. The collection includes numerous black and white photographs, many with attached captions, and negatives, 1936-1981. Photo logs, 1936-1981, and a negative log, 1948-1950, list the image name and/or number of the photo. The collection also includes materials collected by Elliot Wright while doing research on the history of the RNS. Materials include: photocopies of articles on RNS; a small amount of financial information, mainly expenses and budgets; memoranda from Judy Weidman, executive editor, and Lilian Block, managing editor; RNS reports of operation and annual reports, 1984-1981; a staff list, 1977-1978; and a list of correspondence (1979).
